analyzed: ṭhāna aṭhāne yathābhūtam ñāṇam tathāgata balam
translated: Is knowledge of what is possible and impossible a noble power of a Realised One?

original: Maggo phalaṁ nibbānaṁ, sotāpattimaggo sotāpattiphalaṁ, sakadāgāmimaggo sakadāgāmiphalaṁ,
analyzed: maggo phalam nibbāna sotāpatti maggo sotāpatti phala sakadāgāmi maggo sakadāgāmi phala
translated: Is the path, the fruit, and Nibbāna, the path of stream-entry and the fruit of stream-entry, the path of once-returning and the fruit of once-returning,

original: anāgāmimaggo anāgāmiphalaṁ, arahattamaggo arahattaphalaṁ, satipaṭṭhānaṁ sammappadhānaṁ
analyzed: anāgāmi maggaḥ anāgāmi phala arahatta maggaḥ arahatta phala sati paṭṭhānam sammappadhāna
translated: the path of non-returning and the fruit of non-returning, the path of perfection and the fruit of perfection, the foundations of mindfulness, the right efforts,
the bases of spiritual success, the faculties, the powers, the factors of awakening?

analyzed: ṭhāna aṭhāne yathābhūtam ñāṇam tathāgata balam
translated: Is knowledge of what is possible and impossible a noble power of a Realised One?
Is it the object of emptiness?
Is it the object of emptiness?

original: Ṭhānāṭhānañca manasi karoti, suññatañca manasi karotīti?
analyzed: ṭhānāṭhānañca manasi karoti suññatañca manasi karoti iti
translated: Does one pay attention to what is possible and impossible and to emptiness?

original: Ṭhānāṭhānañca manasi karoti, suññatañca manasi karotīti?
analyzed: ṭhānāṭhānañca manasi karoti suññatañca manasi karoti iti
translated: Does one pay attention to what is possible and impossible and to emptiness?

original: Dvinnaṁ phassānaṁ dvinnaṁ cittānaṁ samodhānaṁ hotīti?
analyzed: dvinnam phassānam dvinnam cittānam samodhānam hoti iti
translated: Is there a coming together of two contacts and two thoughts?

analyzed: ṭhāna aṭhāne yathābhūtam ñāṇam tathāgata balam
translated: “Is knowledge of the way things are regarding possible and impossible phenomena a noble supernormal power?”

original: Ṭhānāṭhānañca manasi karoti, appaṇihitañca manasi karotīti?
analyzed: ṭhāna aṭhānam ca manasi karoti appaṇihitam ca manasi karoti iti
translated: “Does one pay attention to possible and impossible phenomena and to the desireless?”

original: Ṭhānāṭhānañca manasi karoti, appaṇihitañca manasi karotīti?
analyzed: ṭhāna aṭhānam ca manasi karoti appaṇihitam ca manasi karoti iti
translated: “Does one pay attention to possible and impossible phenomena and to the desireless?”

original: Dvinnaṁ phassānaṁ dvinnaṁ cittānaṁ samodhānaṁ hotīti?
analyzed: dvinnam phassānam dvinnam cittānam samodhānam hoti iti
translated: “Are there two kinds of contact and two kinds of consciousness?”

analyzed: sati paṭṭhānā ariyā suññatā ārammaṇā ti
translated: “Are the ways of attending to the four establishments of mindfulness noble and their object empty?”

original: Ṭhānāṭhāne yathābhūtaṁ ñāṇaṁ tathāgatabalaṁ ariyaṁ suññatārammaṇanti?
analyzed: ṭhāna aṭhāne yathābhūtam ñāṇam tathāgata balam ariyam suññatā ārammaṇanti
translated: “Is knowledge of the way things are regarding possible and impossible phenomena a noble supernormal power and its object empty?”

analyzed: sati paṭṭhānāḥ ariyāḥ animitta ārammaṇāḥ appaṇihita ārammaṇā ati
translated: “Are the ways of attending to the four establishments of mindfulness noble and their object signless or desireless?”

original: Ṭhānāṭhāne yathābhūtaṁ ñāṇaṁ tathāgatabalaṁ ariyaṁ appaṇihitārammaṇanti?
analyzed: ṭhāna aṭhāne yathābhūtam ñāṇam tathāgata balam ariyam appaṇihita ārammaṇanti
translated: “Is knowledge of the way things are regarding possible and impossible phenomena a noble supernormal power and its object desireless?”

original: Sammappadhānā, iddhipādā, indriyā, balā, bojjhaṅgā ariyā suññatārammaṇāti?
analyzed: sammappadhānāḥ iddhipādāḥ indriyāḥ balāḥ bojjhaṅgāḥ ariyā suññatā ārammaṇā ti
translated: “The right efforts, the bases of spiritual power, the faculties, the powers, the factors for awakening are noble & have emptiness as their essence?”

original: Ṭhānāṭhāne yathābhūtaṁ ñāṇaṁ tathāgatabalaṁ ariyaṁ suññatārammaṇanti?
analyzed: ṭhāna aṭhāne yathābhūtam ñāṇam tathāgata balam ariyam suññatā ārammaṇanti
translated: “The Tathāgata’s knowledge & vision of — and release from — the way things are in the past, future, and present is noble & has emptiness as its essence?”

analyzed: bojjhaṅgāḥ ariyāḥ animitta ārammaṇāḥ appaṇihita ārammaṇā ati
translated: “The factors for awakening are noble & have the signless as their essence … have the desireless as their essence?”

original: Ṭhānāṭhāne yathābhūtaṁ ñāṇaṁ tathāgatabalaṁ ariyaṁ appaṇihitārammaṇanti?
analyzed: ṭhāna aṭhāne yathābhūtam ñāṇam tathāgata balam ariyam appaṇihita ārammaṇanti
translated: “The Tathāgata’s knowledge & vision of — and release from — the way things are in the past, future, and present is noble & has the desireless as its essence?”

original: Na hevaṁ vattabbe …pe….🔽Ṭhānāṭhāne yathābhūtaṁ ñāṇaṁ tathāgatabalaṁ ariyaṁ na vattabbaṁ—
analyzed: na ha ivam vattabbe pe  ṭhāna aṭhāne yathābhūtam ñāṇam tathāgata balam ariyam na

translated: “The Tathāgata’s knowledge & vision of — and release from — the way things are in the past, future, and present is noble & can’t be said to have emptiness as its essence.”

analyzed: āmantā  sati paṭṭhānā ariyā na vattabbā

translated: “The establishings of mindfulness are noble & can’t be said to have emptiness as their essence?”

original: Na hevaṁ vattabbe …pe….🔽Ṭhānāṭhāne yathābhūtaṁ ñāṇaṁ tathāgatabalaṁ ariyaṁ na vattabbaṁ—
analyzed: na ha ivam vattabbe pe  ṭhāna aṭhāne yathābhūtam ñāṇam tathāgata balam ariyam na
a nimitta ārammaṇam pe  appaṇihita ārammaṇanti
translated: “The Tathāgata’s knowledge & vision of — and release from — the way things are in the past, future, and present is noble & can’t be said to have the signless as its essence … to have the desireless as its essence.”
“The establishings of mindfulness are noble & can’t be said to have the desireless as their essence?”

original: Ṭhānāṭhāne yathābhūtaṁ ñāṇaṁ tathāgatabalaṁ ariyaṁ na vattabbaṁ—🔽suññatārammaṇaṁ …pe…
analyzed: ṭhāna aṭhāne yathābhūtam ñāṇam tathāgata balam ariyam na  suññata ārammaṇam pe
translated: “The Tathāgata’s power of knowledge of possibilities and impossibilities is noble and not to be censured in the world …🔽with a void object …
The factors for awakening are noble and not to be censured in the world …

original: Sattānaṁ cutūpapāte yathābhūtaṁ ñāṇaṁ tathāgatabalaṁ ariyanti?
analyzed: sattānam cutūpapāte yathābhūtam ñāṇam tathāgata balam
translated: “The Tathāgata’s power of knowledge of the world is noble and not to be censured in the world …

original: Maggo phalaṁ nibbānaṁ, sotāpattimaggo sotāpattiphalaṁ …pe… bojjhaṅgoti?
analyzed: maggo phalam nibbāna sotāpatti maggo sotāpatti phalam pe bojjhaṅgo ti
translated: “The path, the fruit, and Nibbāna are the stream-entry path, the stream-entry fruit, … the factors for awakening?”

original: Sattānaṁ cutūpapāte yathābhūtaṁ ñāṇaṁ tathāgatabalaṁ ariyanti?
analyzed: sattānam cutūpapāte yathābhūtam ñāṇam tathāgata balam
translated: “The Tathāgata’s power of knowledge of the world is noble and not to be censured in the world …

original: Sattānaṁ cutūpapātañca manasi karoti, suññatañca manasi karotīti?
analyzed: sattānam cutūpapātañca manasi karoti suññatañca manasi karoti iti
translated: “He pays attention to the passing away and reappearance of beings and to voidness?”

original: Sattānaṁ cutūpapātañca manasi karoti, suññatañca manasi karotīti?
analyzed: sattānam cutūpapātañca manasi karoti suññatañca manasi karoti iti
translated: He gives attention to the passing away and reappearance of beings and to voidness?

original: Dvinnaṁ phassānaṁ dvinnaṁ cittānaṁ samodhānaṁ hotīti?
analyzed: dvinnam phassānam dvinnam cittānam samodhānam hoti iti
translated: “Is there a meeting together and a meeting face to face of two kinds of contact and of two kinds of cognizance?
“Is it so that it is not to be said that it is a person who is the same in the eye sense-sphere and in the eye-consciousness element?” …

original: Sattānaṁ cutūpapāte yathābhūtaṁ ñāṇaṁ tathāgatabalaṁ ariyanti?
analyzed: sattānam cutūpapāte yathābhūtam ñāṇam tathāgata balam

“The object of the signless is the object of the desireless?
“Is it so that the Blessed One has not declared the four noble truths?” …
“The object of the desireless is the object of the signless?

original: Sattānaṁ cutūpapātañca manasi karoti, appaṇihitañca manasi karotīti?
analyzed: sattānam cutūpapātañca manasi karoti appaṇihitam ca manasi karoti iti
translated: “He gives attention to the passing away and reappearance of beings and to the desireless?
“Is it so that the Blessed One has not declared the four noble truths?” …

original: Sattānaṁ cutūpapātañca manasi karoti, appaṇihitañca manasi karotīti?
analyzed: sattānam cutūpapātañca manasi karoti appaṇihitam ca manasi karoti iti
translated: “He gives attention to the passing away and reappearance of beings and to the desireless?

original: Dvinnaṁ phassānaṁ dvinnaṁ cittānaṁ samodhānaṁ hotīti?
analyzed: dvinnam phassānam dvinnam cittānam samodhānam hoti iti
translated: “Is there a meeting together and a meeting face to face of two kinds of contact and of two kinds of cognizance?
“Is it so that it is not to be said that it is a person who is the same in the eye faculty and the eye consciousness?” …

analyzed: sati paṭṭhānā ariyā suññata ārammaṇā pe
translated: “The foundations of mindfulness are noble and have voidness as their object …
have the signless as their object …
have the desireless as their object?

original: Sattānaṁ cutūpapāte yathābhūtaṁ ñāṇaṁ tathāgatabalaṁ ariyaṁ appaṇihitārammaṇanti?
analyzed: sattānam cutūpapāte yathābhūtam ñāṇam tathāgata balam ariyam appaṇihita ārammaṇanti

The factors for awakening are noble and have a void object …

original: Sattānaṁ cutūpapāte yathābhūtaṁ ñāṇaṁ tathāgatabalaṁ ariyaṁ appaṇihitārammaṇanti?
analyzed: sattānam cutūpapāte yathābhūtam ñāṇam tathāgata balam ariyam appaṇihita ārammaṇanti

original: Sattānaṁ cutūpapāte yathābhūtaṁ ñāṇaṁ tathāgatabalaṁ ariyaṁ na vattabbaṁ—🔽suññatārammaṇaṁ …pe…

original: Āsavānaṁ khaye yathābhūtaṁ ñāṇaṁ tathāgatabalaṁ ariyanti?
analyzed: āsavānam khaye yathābhūtam ñāṇam tathāgata balam

analyzed: ṭhāna aṭhāne yathābhūtam ñāṇam tathāgata balam

original: Āsavānaṁ khaye yathābhūtaṁ ñāṇaṁ tathāgatabalaṁ ariyanti?
analyzed: āsavānam khaye yathābhūtam ñāṇam tathāgata balam

analyzed: sattānam cutūpapāte yathābhūtam ñāṇam tathāgata balam

translated: The knowledge of the passing away and rebirth of sentient beings is a noble power that is noble?

original: Āsavānaṁ khaye yathābhūtaṁ ñāṇaṁ tathāgatabalaṁ na vattabbaṁ—
analyzed: āsavānam khaye yathābhūtam ñāṇam tathāgata balam na
translated: Knowledge of the destruction of the taints as it really is is not a Tathāgata’s power.
“Is knowledge of the destruction of the pollutants a power of a Realised One that should not be said to be noble?”
“Is it so that it is not to be said that it is a person who is the same in the eye faculty and the eye consciousness?” …

original: Āsavānaṁ khaye yathābhūtaṁ ñāṇaṁ tathāgatabalaṁ ariyaṁ suññatārammaṇanti?
analyzed: āsavānam khaye yathābhūtam ñāṇam tathāgata balam ariyam suññatā ārammaṇanti
translated: “Is knowledge of the destruction of the pollutants a power of a Realised One that is not noble, but is empty of meaning?”

original: Ṭhānāṭhāne yathābhūtaṁ ñāṇaṁ tathāgatabalaṁ ariyaṁ suññatārammaṇanti?
analyzed: ṭhāna aṭhāne yathābhūtam ñāṇam tathāgata balam ariyam suññatā ārammaṇanti
translated: “Is knowledge of the possible and impossible a power of a Realised One that is noble, and empty of meaning?”
“Is it so that the Blessed One has not declared the four noble truths?” …

original: Āsavānaṁ khaye yathābhūtaṁ ñāṇaṁ tathāgatabalaṁ ariyaṁ animittārammaṇaṁ … appaṇihitārammaṇanti?

translated: “Is knowledge of the destruction of the pollutants a power of a Realised One that is noble, and signless?”

original: Ṭhānāṭhāne yathābhūtaṁ ñāṇaṁ tathāgatabalaṁ ariyaṁ appaṇihitārammaṇanti?
analyzed: ṭhāna aṭhāne yathābhūtam ñāṇam tathāgata balam ariyam appaṇihita ārammaṇanti

original: Āsavānaṁ khaye yathābhūtaṁ ñāṇaṁ tathāgatabalaṁ ariyaṁ suññatārammaṇaṁ …pe…🔽animittārammaṇaṁ …pe…
analyzed: āsavānam khaye yathābhūtam ñāṇam tathāgata balam ariyam suññata ārammaṇam pe  a nimitta ārammaṇam pe

“Is knowledge of the destruction of the pollutants a power of a Realised One that is noble, and signless?”

analyzed: sattānam cutūpapāte yathābhūtam ñāṇam tathāgata balam ariyam appaṇihita ārammaṇanti
translated: “Is knowledge of the destruction of the pollutants a power of a Realised One that is noble, and desireless?”🔽“Yes.”🔽“Is knowledge of the passing away and rebirth of beings a power of a Realised One that is desireless?”

original: Ṭhānāṭhāne yathābhūtaṁ ñāṇaṁ tathāgatabalaṁ ariyaṁ na vattabbaṁ—

translated: “The Tathāgata’s power of knowing the way things are in the past, future, and present is noble and not to be censured.

original: Āsavānaṁ khaye yathābhūtaṁ ñāṇaṁ tathāgatabalaṁ ariyaṁ na vattabbaṁ—
analyzed: āsavānam khaye yathābhūtam ñāṇam tathāgata balam ariyam na

original: Ṭhānāṭhāne yathābhūtaṁ ñāṇaṁ tathāgatabalaṁ ariyaṁ na vattabbaṁ—
analyzed: ṭhāna aṭhāne yathābhūtam ñāṇam tathāgata balam ariyam na

original: Āsavānaṁ khaye yathābhūtaṁ ñāṇaṁ tathāgatabalaṁ ariyaṁ na vattabbaṁ—
analyzed: āsavānam khaye yathābhūtam ñāṇam tathāgata balam ariyam na
